title: Easy to set up thee routes you want
comment: Easy to make your routes with waypoints. Became laggy once it creates the route. Next to try actual navigation.

title: Must have for long cycle journeys
comment: It has a few glitches, but it comes up with amazing clever and complex routes that turn a busy road ride into a back street adventure. Brillant stuff

title: I like this app....but
comment: Whilst navigating, the map vanishes and I'm left with a squiggly line... This makes choosing which road to go down when it is not that obvious *eg in the countryside. I downloaded the vector maps, so why do they not work...? I have then selected in the app!

title: To many  bugs please fix
comment: New version work very bad, I am very disappointed. It do not show my position any longer, only on navigate mode, witch it become impossible to navigate the map. The minus a plus bottom are so much need, as an other user say, with gloves it was super hendy. The quiet road calcolation is not always a goog road for bike, maybe a hike or some mtb total off-road path. Please fix bugs..you are my ever best app, I been use it for the start and used for very long distance too..

title: Cycle streets
comment: Really good app for cycle friendly streets, and I like that on live ride it tells you to get ready to turn, my only wish was that at the get ready stage, I wish it told you the upcoming road name as most of the time it doesn't tell you until you're actually turning and if you aren't looking at screen (phone in pocket) it's too late! If that could get updated it would be perfect.

title: To good to be true 😠
comment: Disappointed. Working really well, then sent me round in circles. Suddenly crashed. Trying out a route to work. Good thing that this was on a Saturday.

title: Journey
comment: The mapping software couldn't plan a basic journey.

title: Good for urban route planning, poor for the countryside
comment: CycleStreets is good for urban route planning, avoiding roundabouts & busy roads, and offers choices of busy-ness. The map data is from OpenStreetMap (OSM) which, being open, means you can easily correct errors or add missing data. The developers are responsive to feedback. Negative points: frequency of taking updates from OSM has slowed recently; on longer journeys, Cyclestreets suggests unsurfaced dirt paths suitable for mountain bikes rather than quiet country lanes.

title: Best all round offline maps
comment: Would love a feature to be able to measure between points while offline. So can tell how far away something is. These maps are great for walking as well as cycling.

title: On screen zoom buttons
comment: This new update as lost the + - buttons which which was useful with gloves very useful for biking when pinch and zoom don't work

title: Garbage
comment: Tried to work out my route, this sends me half way up my road then tells me to double back on a half mile detour in the wrong direction. Useless! Uninstalled.

title: Stressfully Slow
comment: Even with offline pack it takes minutes to load. As the pack includes none of the details of OCM it's of limited use anyway. You cannot manipulate the route planner to go a certain way that you prefer, which is essential since no mapping app can ever be perfect. You can go between 2 saved locations or select points on map but not mix the two, which is annoying when most new journeys start or end at saved spots. Route planner has max 10 waypoints which is no good for London's round-the-houses infrastructure.

title: Great voice navigation
comment: Strap phone to my arm and it talks me through the quiet back streets of London. Wish there was better integration with rental bike places showing empty slots near destination.
Choose the Points of Interest menu item and then tick London Cycle Hire points to show docking stations on the journey map. Tap a docking station to see the station capacity and how full it is.

title: Wot, no Lincoln?
comment: Typed in Lincoln in journey planner, only got Lincolns in the USA,  even after downloading UK map. D'OH!! Best stick with the desktop version and use paper maps for travelling. Unless I want to go to the USA...

title: Great
comment: Combined with the offline map pack, this app is superb.

title: Journey planner
comment: It is impossible to find the option to plan a journey by entering start and end destination. Strange app!
The S5 made the menu rather hard to find (press and hold take button for about a second). The new 3.0 release has an onscreen menu button, where you'll find exactly the option you want.

title: Mostly unusable
comment: Conceptually this is a great app. I have found some interesting and useful routes from it and there is nothing else available that does the same job. However I have now given up using it mainly because the mapping is completely unreadable on any current smart phone. The resolution is incompatible and does not scale. It is also pitifully slow to load regardless of bandwidth, exactly like the sustrans website. Geat shame.
The 3.0 release has much better support for high-density screens, so the maps should be much more legible.  Please do give it a try.

title: Poor
comment: To date has failed every time I used it. Either doesn't work with my nexus 5 or incompatible with lollipop.

title: Cycle paths ?
comment: This app seems to ignore cycle paths and instead sends me down country roads, I don't get it, if there's a cycle path from edinburgh to my destination why not use it ???

title: Map won't show!
comment: Just installed it and map worked at first but now every time I open it the screen just fills up with loads of images of the app icon and completely obscures the map. Have had to revert to Google maps which keeps trying to kill me on main roads in central London. HELP! I am a newbie rider with no road sense. I need quiet routes.... Eff off google!!!!

title: It's stopped working
comment: Just keeps saying 'route finding failed'. Although sometimes it finds a route anyway. Also badly needs a menu button for recent Android versions.
The S5 made the menu rather hard to find (press and hold take button for about a second). The new 3.0 release has an onscreen menu button.

title: Much better
comment: I used to get very frustrated as cycle streets wouldn't re-route. I used it today and it was loads better : re-routing just like it should. It took me a great route out of the worst of the traffic but still direct. Now it just needs to let me know the name of the street I'm turning down a second or two earlier and it will be perfect. I use it with one earphone in following verbal directions as I reckon this is safest, wouldn't fancy cycling while trying to follow route on the screen.
You can adjust when the app tells you to turn in the Settings screen.  Try turning that up a little bit.

title: Excellent Routing in London
comment: Looked up a few of my regular journeys and the routing is spot on. Tried the same on Google maps and it recommended mostly main roads with difficult junctions. Not tried live routing.

title: Won't open
comment: Just give the message Unexpected Error
Cycle street app

title: Superb
comment: You need the huge offline map pack also, or a good data budget. Get handlebar mount on Amazon. Phone with front facing speakers on full. Another app to leave screen on. I get about 3hrs cycling before battery dies.  It navigates me from central London to green belt flawlessly, and the girl speaks quite posh, which is a bonus and startles chavvy passers-by :) Incredibly good free app, mind bending.  Please stop those carping, reviews guys, or do some free coding!
If you're using the LiveRide and want the screen to stay on, tap the Padlock icon on the top right to lock it on.

title: Brilliant routes
comment: This app generates the best routes, especially if you are after the relaxed little streets. Navigation got really good in a recent version.

title: Works in Berlin
comment: This is great. I have used it in London and now in Berlin.  On a Nexus 7.  So have to have it offline with just the GPS to find me.  So long as  you preload the area it seems to work very well and unlike Google has the finer detail.
Great app it will help with my cycle routes in the country. Working out milage and approximate times

title: Very Useful
comment: Fancy a trip to a certain place but don't want to spend an hour working out a route - this app is invaluable. You can specify what type of journey you want to take, fastest, shortest, quietest etc. You can download a map to use offline and can plan a route on your home WiFi then follow it whilst offline - just be careful to keep on track as if the app tries to re-plan the route it will stall if it cannot connect to the net.  You have to get used to the foibles of the convoluted cycle paths, links and road networks but most real issues I have had are down to the limitations of the GPS on my phone.

title: All you need
comment: All you need for finding cycle routes, navigation don't always pick cycle routes when wanting directions during cycling but then I never really use that bit.

title: Cycle Streets
comment: Occasionally superb. Frequently doesn't load. Very frustrating.  Not up to date in spite of massive investment and SUSTRANS backing of Nidderdale Cycleway. Now use online Google maps and offline MapsWithMe.

title: No option to search for an address?
comment: Seems like a pretty big thing to miss off a route planning app. Really do not understand the thinking there.
If you bring up the menu and select the "Plan a route" option, you can plan a route by search for address or in combination with markers on the map.
So far so good good details and plenty of options

title: Turn by turn nav is hopeless
comment: The route planning is great but turn-by-turn gps navigation is hopeless. You're past a turn before it tells you to turn. Completely unusable in cities.
You can adjust when voice prompts happen using the LIveRide settings. You can find those on the rightmost tab, hit the Settings button, then scroll down.

title: CycleStreets LiveRide has the edge over Google's turn by turn Navigation
comment: Yesterday I cycled 20 miles just north of London on back roads listening to voice navigation delivered by bluetooth headset (bluedio EH) and not looking at the screen.  The main differences I see between CycleStreets and Google are 1) CycleSteets provides the name of each street, not the road number which is helpful on small back roads which are named but not numbered 2)  CycleStreets tells you when you are off route and when to turn around, Google seems to just replan the route silently (and that requires a permanent wireless connection)  3) CycleStreets confirms all 'straight ons'  at junctions. Bascially CycleStreets talks to you more often and gives you more confidence that you are on the right route.  As an aside turn by turn navigation requires GPS to be on all the time which uses loads of power.  So I don't use CycleStreets on my phone. I run the CycleStreets on a tablet tossed into my pannier which can provide many hours of GPS navigation.

title: Poor, maybe even dangerous.
comment: I've tried to persevere with this app. I checked my usual commute via local cycle path network,  and I was unable to understand the description, even though the route was the one I ride. Describes curves as turns, doesn't know where the mini roundabouts are, or where the barriers are, just flummoxed, if live this to be great, but it is simply useless. Not to be trusted I'd say, you were warned!
The route map menu has both "Plan a route" to allow you to enter start and end addresses, and "Find location" if you want to centre the map on a specific address or post code.
Brilliant

title: des lloyd
comment: This app is so slow and I have a super fast connection.  Its like living in the dial up 90s.

title: Pretty Good!
comment: I quite like this app, great to have detailed audio navigation. Pretty accurate too! Good for following a new route. If only you could set more than 10 waypoints. I thought creating an account might do that, but no. Does anyone know if there is a way?

title: Cycle streets
comment: Cycle. Route planner

title: Good App but no good if you have a S5
comment: Cannot set routes on a Samsung S5 as Samsung removed the menu button.
Apparently the S5 does still have a menu button, it's just hidden - http://www.androidcentral.com/samsung-galaxy-s5-menu-button-hidden

title: Planner?
comment: Far from intuitive, no idea how to set or find a destination other that scrolling around the map. Uninstalled
The route map menu has both "Plan a route" to allow you to enter start and end addresses, and "Find location" if you want to centre the map on a specific address or post code.

Used this app for the first time today. I reached my destination but only after having to double back on myself a few times due to the voice navigation being slow at telling when I needed to turn - this was even after changing the settings to be notified 150m before a turn, hopefully this will be sorted in later versions. I will definitely try it again though and hopefully be able to add another star or 2 :)
Great app. Would be better if you could add/move waypoints to adjust the route after it has been calculated.  It's a pain to have to start again to make modifications to the route.

title: Balanced routes are fantastic
comment: This is a brilliant cycling app. I kept getting lost in the back streets of London in trying to avoid main roads or link up the London cycle routes. This has made it so much easier to avoid hotspots like elephant & castle. Only gripe,  I wish the live ride wasn't locked to portrait orientation. I'd find it useful in landscape most times.

title: Simple, brilliant, free!!!
comment: Create route from your waypoints.

title: 'Routing failed'
comment: Every time

title: A lot to prove - but amazingly seems to deliver
comment: Plus points: excellent at plotting what they call a "balanced" route; avoiding very busy roads & uphills. Minus points: "liveride" voice navigation is pretty poorly implemented and simply a pain most of the time, advising turns after you've passed them. Screen lock/unlock icon needs to be clearer.
You can adjust when voice prompts happen using the LIveRide settings. You can find those on the rightmost tab, hit the Settings button, then scroll down.

title: Simply amazing
comment: Nice tool to help you getting around on 2 wheels. Esp. Live ride is practical on new routes. Just listen + ride.

title: Best mapping app
comment: it really works well finding the optimum route for your needs

title: Amazing
comment: Great for planning cycle routes through unfamiliar areas. The liveride feature is basically a turn by turn satnav with spoken directions which works pretty well.

title: Cycle streets journey planner
comment: Has stopped me cycling up and down the same trail all the time. Excellent for planning long cycle rides.

title: Good App
comment: Great app for planning your routes if you are very careful tapping.  No way of deleting a wrongly tapped way point or dragging it to where it is needed. Basically have to start again with a new route. VERY VERY irritating due to lack of deleting and clearing the displays. However I can put up with it and better than anything else. Dave
Misplaced markers can be removed either by tapping the on screen back button in the lower left of the screen, or using your phone's back softkey.

title: Really good but needs some work
comment: Really good app, would be better if you could view elevation data for planned routes, re-routing was quicker and better UI.

title: Avoids cycle paths
comment: According to this app the best route between two points on a purpose built cycle path which is marked on the map is to use the main road which runs alongside it.
It might be that the underlying OpenStreetMap data is not up to date.  If you can give the route details at http://www.cyclestreets.net/feedback/ we can investigate.

title: Great app
comment: Good for getting oot and aboot

title: Rubbish.
comment: Slow and rubbish.  Need more apps along these lines.

title: Useless usability
comment: Only seems to plot from current location. It is useless trying to plot from a to b. A simple touch on the map of the start and end points please

A touch on the map to mark the start and end points is exactly how you can use this app.  Tap on the map to set the start, shown in a green marker, tap the map to set the end point, shown with a red marker, then tap at the top where it says "Tap here to route".

title: Great app
comment: It's not as slick as Google maps, but it works beautifully as a cycle sat nav and I trust the directions more. It helped me to find a great regular commute across London.

title: Brilliant
comment: Ideal for walking and cycling

title: The best routing app
comment: Excellent... Voice navigation  fantastic

title: Pretty good
comment: Good functionality. Slight problem with high density screens (eg Nexus 5) - the maps are too small to read.

title: Best way to get around
comment: Has improved a lot since it was first launched.

title: Not good
comment: Not enough points to plot a larger route

title: Very good but key improvements needed
comment: Superb in almost every aspect. Very impressive routing, albeit with a tenancy to chide one for being off route where a choice of cycle lanes is available either side of a main road. Voice navigation will be great if it can be made to announce turns in advance. At the moment when I hear "get ready" my heart starts racing, waiting for a direction which usually comes half way across the required junction. So close.
Latest update makes the "chiding distance" and turn warning distance configurable in the Settings.  See what you think.
Nice app

title: Cant believe its free!
comment: Great app! Just what i was after. I used to spend ages looking at maps trying to find the quietest route. But now this app does it for me :)

title: Great app
comment: I would only suggest the possibility to upload your own gpx files

title: Not too bad.
comment: Not too bad an app, would be better if the app rotated to show you direction of travel rather than a fixed-north aspect.  Also, voice guidance is quite good but needs a few tweaks.  It would benefit from more frequent updates on distance to turn, and more of a warning when actually approaching the turn; atm the turn warning comes when you're at the junction.  Final issue, the route marker can at times be hard to distinguish from other map icons, I'd rather colours designating road types were more subdued with the route marker being brought into bold.  Other than those, this is quite a good cycling GPS.
Earlier warning of turns should be with you now.  Map rotation too, in due course.

title: Needs improvements
comment: Great app but would like earlier notification of turns, you tend to be past the turn when at medium speed which can be dangerous particularly on right turns!
Configurable notifications should be with you now.

title: Great up to a point
comment: All very good until I tried to register,and I lost patience trying to get my username accepted . Five letters and the app had filled the line entirely.This happened on 2 devices.Suggest this is spoiling an otherwise excellent app.
Version 2.1, which should be with you now, should fix this issue.

title: Simply brilliant
comment: Works perfectly, does everything I wanted and more. Thank you!

title: Great, needs more customisation?
comment: Routing is excellent. Audio guidance great, but would like to have a preference re early turn warning to 'get ready', ideally calculated from distance and speed at current location; often warnings are too late really, if at high speed, or by contrast, directions while in a queue at static junctions (waiting at give way, traffic lights etc) don't arrive until right on the junction itself. Best ad hoc cycling nav app out there.
Configurable turn notifications are in the 2.1 release, which should be with you now.

title: Not to be trusted
comment: Yes it navigated me 240 miles in 2 days, but I didn't think a private airfield runway and several muddy woodland footpaths were the ideal environment for a road bike. Uninstalled.

title: AMAZING!!
comment: been struggling finding offline navigation systems for a specific route capability for college journey. i came across this and it is PERFECT. thank you creator :D

title: Works with my Pebble watch.
comment: Adding the turn by turn navigation has been really useful. Now I can get route instructions on my Pebble when using it in conjunction with Pebble Notifier. I do agree that the instructions come too late though. The 'Get Ready' comes on arrival at the junction and not before. It's suitable notice for walking pace but too late for cycling when you need about 50 yds notice of what to do next.

title: Decent enough
comment: The audio sat-nav is a great concept, and you're to be congratulated on it, however, it needs to instruct you far sooner than it does, too often it's giving you an instruction to turn AFTER you pass the turn.  Instead of "get ready", how about "prepare for left/right turn"?

title: Excellent cycle journey planning & live navigation
comment: Cycling around London this is invaluable.  Excellent routing (if, at times, a little bendy) which always gets me where I'm going.  Routing is based on open street map data so I can correct any (very rare) problems with the underlying map data.  The new voice guidance mode is fabulous - not perfect yet but very good, on an 8.5 mile ride on roads I didn't know & only had to turn screen on a handful of times. If it could announce what the next turn is when it says "Get ready" that would be a major improvement.

title: Fairly useless so far
comment: Would like to see the sustrans routes keyed on the 'points of interest'  and also all local routes. So I can browse. I'd like to be able to tell you where they are. I'd like voice instructions. I'd like the app tied to Google Street view, showing me images of where I should be turning, 'unnamed track' isn't very helpful.

Voice instruction is available now.

The Sustrans routes are shown on the OpenCycleMap Map style. National cycle routes are shown in red, regional routes in light blue, and local routes in dark blue.

While it would be great to use Google Street view, Google's terms of service don't allow it.

author_name: Jose Luiz da Silva Costa Filho
title: Bike should always point up.
comment: I love this app. Even better now with the guided navigation feature. However, it would only be complete if the bike always pointed up and the map moved around the bike instead of the bike moving around the map. Thanks for all the good work. I use it every day. :-)

title: much improved
comment: all looks good, but will never use it till routing engine offline, using the better 'osmand'.

I think it's unlikely we'll ever do offline routing.  Using the main cyclestreet.net routing engine allows for much better routes to be produced as the underlying map data is bang up-to-date, and the routing engine isn't memory-constrained.  
The app does cache routes though, so you can plan your journey in advance and retrieve it later.

title: Plan a route
comment: It's a must for planning a route, on mobile or on laptop, even transfer to GPS.

title: Package error fixed
comment: Best cycle planner ....
Updated package should be with you now.

title: Fixed. Thank you.
comment: "Will not D/L update. Tried to reinstall but failed "package not signed correctly"" previous review by me, today. Top dev' fixed it and replied here, the same day. Added voice 5*
Updated package should be with you now.

title: Poor Update
comment: Won't update (package file not signed correctly - galaxy S2).
Sorry, I messed up the release.  Updated package should be with you now.

title: Terrific
comment: The perfect journey planner hasn't been invented yet, but this is pretty great.
Can't download, package signed  incorrectly, nexus 4
Sorry, I messed up the release. Updated package should be with you now.

title: Cannot update on GalaxyS3
comment: I keep getting an error message saying 'package file not signed correctly'.
Sorry, I messed up the release.  Updated package should be with you now.

title: Offline maps
comment: The app also has an offline vector maps pack (downloaded separately). However there is a fundamental flaw, the NCN Routes are not available in the offline vector maps. This a real shame - they are available if you use the open cycle maps - but but bet your bottom dollar when your in the middle of the Pennines or the highlands you're not getting a 3G signal for it to be any use.  SHAME!

title: NEEDS voice to be any good
comment: 1. Voice(soon please) 2.Gradient details... is it there, coz I can't find it?  As a planner it is just what I wanted. Feedback options are còólio... pity Guurgle haven't done this with their cycling option.  I shan't be using it whilst cycling as it would be irresponsible and dangerous without voice and tedious to stop at every junction.  It is, however, the best planner I have tried for the torturous hills around my South Molton home.  Bring on the update. ...
Voice navigation is in the latest update.  No gradient details yet, I'm afraid, but I'll bear it in mind for the future.

title: Nice app
comment: Used it today to workout a good little route no complaints so far.
The most unintuitive interface I've ever used! Where do you start to plan a route is still a mystery.
Choose 'Plan a route' from the menu to enter addresses.  Alternatively you can tap on the map to set your start and end of the journey, then hit where it says 'Tap here to Route'.

title: Pretty good app.
comment: Good for planning a route but you can't seem to edit the waypoints of an existing route. I found this to be very annoying when trying to plot a specific route. I had to start from scratch to re-route a tiny section!

title: Essential if touring around the UK.
comment: Will get you from A to B, you can update map where's there's routes that aren't on the current map, and essential when out on the bike following cycle routes which aren't always marked, clearly shows where you are and where you missed that turning with the hidden cycle route number. And the offline map pack helps when no phone signal.

title: Pretty good!
comment: Overall pleased with this app and will use it again. Used it today and to be fair it choose a good route.  However, it may send you down some paths that are unsuitable for road bikes. Through feedback you can alert other rider's to this, which I have done. Obviously, it would earn its fifth star if it had speech guidance because it's no fun having to keep stopping to see where you have to go. A function where you could save your routes would also be useful. No crashes.Samsung Galaxy SIII mini.
Routes are automatically saved - see the "Saved routes" menu item.  Speech guidance is available now.

title: Good potential, terrible practicality
comment: This says its a route planner and that's exactly what it does and nothing else, its like it expects you to memorise the route and then turn it off, it dosent offer voice directions or an up to date map at any point during you journey, that's if you have good enough eyes to squint mid cycle at the tiny arrow that's suppose to be you. Everyone use bikehub its brilliant
Voice directions are available now.

title: Routing designed by cyclists, Open Street Map data
comment: Great cycle map for planning journeys for bikes not walkers, not cars, not lorries - BIKES!

title: Needs some work
comment: Great when it works, maps go blank regularly on journey. Would be easier to type in start and end points like a sat nav.
You can type start and end points, and waypoints if you wish, using the "Plan a route" menu option.

title: Could be great
comment: Just get a blank screen since update. Need to be able to download map to phone so no trouble when no connection. The caching option is rubbish.

title: Must have!
comment: So much info and usability! Every cyclist must have this!

title: Needs work
comment: This app has good potential, and i like that users can contribute to help keep it up to date. My problem is i almost never use this app because it is incapable of giving voice instructions. If i could get turn by turn voice instructions i would use the app every day. Problem is having to stop constantly or stare at the screen to find the next turning instruction makes my morning commute a nightmare! Voice instructions would be greatly appreciated. For now ill stick to google maps.
Voice directions are available now.

title: Excellent app
comment: Very useful & becomes ever more so as people contribute routes and corrections to OpenStreetMaps (the Wikepeda of the map world).

title: Really good app...
comment: Easy to use, picks sensible routes according to user preferences - definitely recommended.

title: Currently unusable
comment: Detailed maps but they are rendered useless by the app crashing constantly. Will change my review if the app is updated but I'm a bit annoyed at the map. Plotted a route of approx 40 miles, clicked on 'route' and it instantly crashed and lost all my work.

title: absolutely amazing
comment: The quiet routes in London are incredible, it almost makes the city feel cycle friendly when you use these route. I would never be so keen and confident to get out on my bike if it wasn't for your great work. AD free and developed by cyclists for cyclists. I'm using Bike Hub also for navigation. Liked it so much I decided to donate to the cause!

title: Zoom issue
comment: It is a very good app, however once I get directions to my way points and zoom into to see the roads I should take, the direction disappears! I can only view the direction when I an zoomed out which isn't very helpful. Please fix this major issue and it will easily be a 5* app!

title: Really useful
comment: Excellent, great options HTC one X+

title: Best for routes across London
comment: Great app. Best place to find quiet cycles routes in London. Highly recommend. If it could speak directions as well - well that would be perfect!

title: Problems, Samsung galaxy nexus
comment: When I zoom in just once, the route disappears!! Not very useful at all

title: Not a bad App
comment: It's easy to use and gives plenty of very good information. On the downside, it keeps sending me the wrong way along one way streets. It also insists on routing me up the two biggest hills in my area, even though much quicker and easier routes are available. It's definitely a very useable app, but there's room for improvement.

title: Missing lots of cycle paths
comment: If it didn't consistently disappoint me by not including numerous cycle paths I know exist in it's routes, this might be a good app. Though the fact the map takes ages to load when on mobile data is also very annoying when actually using it to navigate...  Not impressed!

title: Sorry, Not better than Google
comment: This app may be better on established cycle routes, I dont know, being a professional tester, I would think of all possible uses and give it to a first time user who has never used the app or route and ask him to go with just the app's instructions. I did a long cycling today through very busy country-type roads (even on quiet version) in Surrey and the app took me through dangerous busy roads, steep and painful. I had a chat with a local and he told me the best route. I did use this app in Bristol, which is a cycling city and hence what you google is what you get, I formed the opinion that this app is very good. But sorry. OK in London and Bristol, or wherever there are cycling routes but otherwise (I hate to say) use google. I will not give more than 1 star.   I should say there is not a single good app for cycling routes. We just have to wait for a better app.

title: Very poor
comment: Not only is this app very poor at calculating the time it takes to get from a to b... It does not take into account for all the available cycle tracks and takes you off on to unnecessary road which not only adds more time but add more distants on to your journey. When i saw this app i thought "yea.. A cycle app that's good" Boy was i wrong. Uninstalled :-(

title: Superb - thanks
comment: Easy to use, good routing, particularly like being able to easily drop waypoints onto map, offline map pack works well, great to have all the permissable cycle routes - much better than using eg google maps.

title: Ceci n'est pas une critique
comment: This review intentionally left blank

title: Routes well, and but can't log in... Fixed!
comment: Update... After mentioning my issue the app has been updated with a fix. So not only is it a good routing app, the support is excellent as well. In comparison to Google Maps new cycle routing CycleStreets makes proper use of available infrastructure like bridleways or footpaths (pointing out that you need to walk).

title: The original and best cycle journey planner
comment: Google has good maps, and apple's are laughable. This app uses openstreetmap with cycling specific data. The routes it suggests are the ones I would actually take, unlike those suggested by Google (which I hope will improve it's cycle mapping over time). My 10 mile journey into work includes 1 mile on roads, but Google suggests a route with 5 miles on much busier (60 mph) roads.

title: Brilliant app
comment: Routes on open streets are reliable and can be imported into Bryton rider 50 and memory map.

title: An excellent app
comment: Route planning is first rate and is the best cycling app

title: The best UK Cyclist's map for UK
comment: This is a great app, obviously designed and maintained by people who actually use it.  It can now use offline vector maps as well.  The suggested routes are almost always sensible and the best choices.  It would be nice to be able to set one's own personal average speed for the estimated times and it would be good to be able to have more waypoints per journey but these are minor points and I can't think of any function that doesn't already work really well.

title: Wow!
comment: Can't believe this app, is free. Excellent & highly recommended.

title: Bad
comment: Put my first address in and it was constantly giving me the long way round, sucks big time

title: Cycle map
comment: Great map

title: Rubbish. Stick to proper satnav
comment: I live next to a cycle path in Grays, Essex and tried to plot a route to Tilbury. Despite living 10 metres from the cycle path, it kept putting me along main roads. Crap

title: Rubbish
comment: Unable to find any on my routes, how hard would it be to just be able to draw where you wanted to go. Uninstalled

title: True useability.
comment: Previously used BikeHub and recently Google Maps cycling mode both of which had limitations. CycleStreets fits the bill of a Cycle GPS Navigator and route planner, especially with the recent offline Maps Pack. I need never worry about a poor data connection again. Definitely recommended.
Excellent application.

title: Excellent cycle routes
comment: Has helped me find new traffic free routes through London. Highly recommended.

title: Please stop the blog notifications!
comment: Good app. Would be good if you could toggle notifications, save/export tracks to GPS files. Sometimes doesn't load any tiles up when I have the offline maps installed and selected. On g3.

title: Latest update
comment: Not loving the blog notifications, can we lose them please.  Great app otherwise.

title: Great
comment: Love the new map pack

title: Awesome
comment: This application has been a life saver when touring around Britain.  Maybe a future feature warn you of the condition of the trail and gradient. I am turning into a regular donator

title: Fantastic
comment: I just bought a new bike and was looking for something to give me good routes around London and this app fits the bill - much better than some of the others, and the GPS hasn't lost connection yet.  My one gripe and I'm hoping someone can help, is how do you stop the screen for turning off whilst riding?  Other than that, an excellent app!

title: Great app - tired of a certain SPAMMER
comment: @Ted - 08/07/2012 - your record must be scratched. Please stop SPAMMING negative 1 star reviews on every cycle app you find, and stop promoting ZANavi with the same level of SPAMMING viggor.  This is a perfectly acceptable app.

title: Unreliable
comment: Crashed four out of five times on my Samsung note.

title: Nice
comment: Quality routing, based on OSM for up-to-date maps

title: Best Cycle Sat Nav App
comment: Cyclestreets journey planner is the best bicycle SatNav in UK. In combination with the new map pack it is really fast. It has changed my trips when I visit London and other places where I need help to navigate.

title: Best cycle routing...
comment: ...app for Android. Map tile cache bug seems to have been fixed now too :)

title: Cycle path?
comment: Will not send me down ANY CYCLE PATH, even ones that are clearly show on the map, would rather send me down the busy A40 than down some quiet cycle lanes that are shorter in distance.

title: Best of the lot
comment: Just been trying out the other apps similar to this and it seems the mist stable & comprehensive. Love the interface & the various functions, it will inspire me for more rides in new areas. Good work!

title: Incomplete
comment: Nice UI & decent journey-planning, but this is useless as a live navigation app for several reasons: no voice output of navigation instructions; no automatic re-routing; no bypassing the lock-screen.

title: Fantastic
comment: Just what I needed  Commuting by bike is much more fun than being stuck in a tin box

title: could be great...
comment: ...but the map does not load smoothly and it has left me high and dry on too many occasions. not reliable enough for when you're out and about and lost!

title: Very slow loading of map tiles
comment: Features are ok, but when out and about, the map rules load very slowly, or not at all, even when on 3G+. Is slow on 20Mbps broadband too.

title: great app just wish for more local knowledge
comment: But that will come in time. I like the fact it's for cyclists by cyclists (as you can see on the webpage). I also like the fact it doesn't just cover London or Oxford or the south east. I live in aberdeen and it found new routes easily. I don't mind it not saving. I wish I could share the route more easily (street by street) with a notepad app so I don't have to keep internet on my phone all the time when I'm cycling. Maybe it is slow to load but so is google maps for me.  A bike app everyone should have :)

title: Much better since the update
comment: Well done :)

title: Awesomely useful, shame about the lag
comment: And free! Had helped me try routes I'd never have tried using google maps.
Does what it says on the tin

title: Excellent app
comment: Great to find an app that goes to cycle paths before anything else. Makes my weekly bike trips much easier

title: Not working well
comment: Fails to download maps as I move around or zoom in/out. This makes it pretty useless on my Samsung galaxy s2.

title: Poor
comment: Poor compared to other applications. So many missing features including a proper way to save routes (currently saves the most recent few regardless whether you want them or whether it means overwriting another more useful one), spoken directions and an *efficient* way to download and install maps for offline use. Other items are listed by other people who strangely proceed to give four or five stars?

title: Room for improvement
comment: Pretty good. Has some usability issues, like having to use the map to specify waypoints - addresses would be nice. Also no save/recall functionality...(that I can figure out at least!)
Brilliant app

title: Good, but not great
comment: Impressed with it's usability and routing...    but... icons are low resolution (slightly blurry), no inverted colour mode for night cycling in low light, no Turn-by-Turn speech inbuilt, the background to the text should be 'black' not a light grey (so you can see it easier in daylight), can't zoom close enough to read the road names (not too bad, but isn't helpful), photo upload could give a few resolution options as 320 is from the 1950's (given most of the current mobile devices about these days), uploading a full size image (from my old phone with a 5Mp camera ) is still a little over kill and what the hell is with colour scheme... I honestly can't work out what a 'hill' is or a normal/flat road?!    Still, nice app, but does need work []^_^]  HTC HD2 (NexusHD) with Android 4.0 iCS CM9

title: Nice
comment: Great app
Havent rode with it yet but i know my area well and this chooses great routes suiting your style and the time estimate seems pretty accurate

title: Very useful:
comment: Similar functionality to cyclestreets website- handy to have accessible on the move.
Maps keep failing to load. Showed route down a private drive!

title: Genius
comment: The only decent cycle route planner in the UK and it really does work

title: Good but has awesome potential
comment: Love the app only downside seems to be the speed at which it renders. Would live to sew a premium version possibly with offline mapping
Intuitive, useful, well put together

title: unintuitive route setting
comment: never could set a route..

title: Brilliant wayfinder
comment: The Ordnance Survey OpenData map style is so legible - better usability by far than any paper maps/books IMHO. I'd have to carry a plans chest to store the amount of accessible visible readable info. Just unbelievable colour, clarity, detail and scale. Quick to load here on HTC desire Z. Better interface than google maps, too.

title: NCRs not highlighted on standard map
comment: I fell off the route while trying to follow NCR path. Map shows paths but doesnt highlight sustrans NCR routes. Otherwise excellent. Ive now found the NCR routes by using the contour map.

title: Excellent
comment: Great that pubs are marked on maps, that rerouting from current location is supported. Would like to have a way to export routes to Google maps too!
Takes to much time for maps to load , would be at destination by time it fully loaded on x10

title: nice app - map loading slow
comment: Map loading very very slow and can't zoom to lowest level. Ordinace Survey maps load a little ok, but could be faster.
Desire he. Crashes out. No voice guidance. But. Very fast road analyser. Just needs stop crashing and voice
Very helpful app :)
Best app of it's type. Good route planning, detailed map including national cycle paths. Slow to load though.
Good but has flaws.Map tiles slow,stop loading after a bit.Accepting postcode suggestion results in not found.Can't create 2nd route using tap points.
Pretty good. Why does it need contacts permission though? And you should consider using mapsforge.
Not the clearest of maps but invaluable routing for discovering nice cycle routes

title: Prove to work colleagues they too can cycle in
comment: Great fun using this to prove it's possible to get from peoples homes to work. Only critique is the slow loading base map when on 3G. On wireless at home or work it's fine.
Superb. On desire hd android 2.3
I love this, it does everything I want it to. It's fast, easy to follow whilst cycling and has a lot of route planning options. Works on my Xperia 8.

title: Works great on HTC Wildfire too
comment: Same great cycle routing as the PC/internet version, and I'm very impressed with the response speeds. Lovely piece of work, guys.
A real must have. I love this app. Been looking for ages! accurate and fast. I use it in london on htc desire hd. Thank you!

title: Works great on HTC Desire
comment: It installed easily and can be moved to SD card. Maps come up quickly and scroll easily. Produces routes where I live that are the same or similar to what I would use anyway. Really good app. Only minor comment would be that the 'back' key exits the application too often rather than going back to the main screen. Really the best bike app for Android!
The best cycling app out there, bar none. Well worth the wait, and can't wait to see where the dev team takes it!
Best cycling app by far

title: Excellent
comment: CycleStreets provide the best cycle routing its great to finally have them on my phone. The app has a really easy to understand interface, and quick routing. It is missing 3rd person turn by turn navigation, which is a big hole, but I'm sure they're working on it.
Awesome app works well
